oai_dc:dc.dc:title: VERTICALLY VARYING VELOCITY FIELD IN Q-3D NEARSHORE CIRCULATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sanchez-Arcilla, A.
Collado, F.
Rodriguez, A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: circulation
quasi-3d circulation
vertically varying velocity
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents an efficient and economic technique to obtain vertical profiles for surf-zone wave-induced currents. The current-wave bottom boundary layer is solved in a parameterized manner, while employing a power series aproximation to obtain the solution in the middle layer (extending up to trough level). This "profile extraction technic" has been coupled to a 2DH surf-zone circulation model which is also concisely described. The paper ends with a brief discussion of some obtained results part of the calibration work which is a very much on going task.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 23 (1992): Proceedings of 23rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Venice, Italy, 1992.
